intro: Crepis capillaris f. integra, commonly known as the hairy mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has a low-growing habit and produces numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This variety is notable for its distinct hairy appearance and is often found in disturbed habitats.
